summary:
Jan Oostenbrink is initiating, developing and supporting cross-border cooperation, in all kinds of areas, through clear communication and an effective process management and project monitoring. Intercultural management and going beyond communication are necessary for realizing a win - win situation. Extensive knowledge of and practical experience in cross-border cooperation, built up in many years, have given me a profound basis as moderator, project leader and process manager in the public, non-profit and business sector.

By bringing people together from different countries and different cultures, new (business) networks are set up and new horizons discovered. In this I am the connection between actors and themes,  Moving and motivating people and thinking “out of the box” makes them go across (their) borders.

During last years I have been mainly involved in TEN-T (Trans-European network for transport and logistics), health care, cross border innovation and knowledge transfer, science to business and in enhancing Dutch - German B2B relations.
